meanings.definition: To cover or coat with lather.
meanings.sent1: She was lathering the soap on her hands before washing them.
meanings.sent2: The barber was lathering the shaving cream on the customer's face.
meanings.sent3: The puppy thought it was fun to lather its toy with bubbles.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to be lathering the sky with shades of pink at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The chef skillfully lathered the sauce over the dish, creating a delicious masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The foam or froth formed when a detergent is agitated in water.
meanings.sent1: The lathering on top of the washing machine indicated the detergent was working.
meanings.sent2: After stirring the soap vigorously, a thick lathering appeared in the basin.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they created a lathering bubble bath in the tub.
meanings.sent4: The ocean waves crashed against the rocks, creating a lathering of white foam.
meanings.sent5: The barista skillfully poured the milk, creating a perfect lathering on top of the latte.
